column4: need a bit of help here, i installed java, and created a link to the firefox/plugins, but no dice
you need a java plugin, not a java interpreter, but dont you get a popup when you try to load the applet pointint you to what you need?
no. i only got links to download jre6u17 with instructions to install it
well i think i just installed ubuntu-restricted-extras and ended up with java support in the browser, you definitly do not have to create symlinks in any case
well, if i go to about:plugins in firefox, there's no plugin info for java.
do you have ubuntu-restricted-extras installed?
indeed
there is a sun-java6-plugin - The Java(TM) Plug-in, Java SE 6
you mind taking a look at this link?
what link
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1373145
i have java installed, it's just not being picked up.. unless i bolo'd something
well that is the way i used to install a plugin too
what do you mean by 'output' ?
if you open a console and type firefox it will typically output some stuff in the console while its running
no, just opened a new clean browser
why not try installing the plugin from the repo instead?
which one?
sun-java6-plugin
ok, working on it. but i got an error telling me to 'dpkg --configure -a' due to an error ? o.O
means an installation/update was previously interupted
and thats how to fix it
ya, it worked. just never seen that before
thanks for solvin my issue
